metadata.title: CVE-2019-11579 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
dhcp.c in dhcpcd before 7.2.1 contains a 1-byte read overflow withDHO_OPTSOVERLOADED.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11579` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dhcpcd5 - 7.1.0-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: dhcpcd5 package in esm-apps/jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.1.0-2').
